com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl

Class RenderSessionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameworkResourceIdProvider
      • com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl.RenderAction<SessionParams>
        • com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl.RenderSessionImpl

  • public class RenderSessionImpl
extends RenderAction<SessionParams>
    Class implementing the render session. A session is a stateful representation of a layout file. It is initialized with data coming through the Bridge API to inflate the layout. Further actions and rendering can then be done on the layout.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RenderSessionImpl(SessionParams params)
      Creates a layout scene with all the information coming from the layout bridge API.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderSessionImpl

        public RenderSessionImpl(SessionParams params)
        Creates a layout scene with all the information coming from the layout bridge API.

        This must be followed by a call to RenderSessionImpl#init(), which act as a call to RenderAction.acquire(long)

        See Also:
        LayoutBridge#createScene(com.android.layoutlib.api.SceneParams)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public Result init(long timeout)
        Initializes and acquires the scene, creating various Android objects such as context, inflater, and parser.
        Overrides:
        init in class RenderAction<SessionParams>
        Parameters:
        timeout - the time to wait if another rendering is happening.
        Returns:
        whether the scene was prepared
        See Also:
        RenderAction.acquire(long), RenderAction.release()

      • inflate

        public Result inflate()
        Inflates the layout.

        RenderAction.acquire(long) must have been called before this.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current context is different than the one owned by the scene, or if init(long) was not called.

      • render

        public Result render(boolean freshRender)
        Renders the scene.

        RenderAction.acquire(long) must have been called before this.

        Parameters:
        freshRender - whether the render is a new one and should erase the existing bitmap (in the case where bitmaps are reused). This is typically needed when not playing animations.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current context is different than the one owned by the scene, or if RenderAction.acquire(long) was not called.
        See Also:
        RenderParams#getRenderingMode(), RenderSession#render(long)

      • animate

        public Result animate(java.lang.Object targetObject,
                      java.lang.String animationName,
                      boolean isFrameworkAnimation,
                      IAnimationListener listener)

        RenderAction.acquire(long) must have been called before this.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current context is different than the one owned by the scene, or if RenderAction.acquire(long) was not called.
        See Also:
        RenderSession#animate(Object, String, boolean, IAnimationListener)
